[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The RecyclingHub (RH) defines requirements for managing user profiles, recycling facilities, schedules, and environmental tracking.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: RH enables users to search facilities, schedule drop-offs, track recycling history, and generate impact reports.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: RH integrates with Google Maps, email services, and recycling databases.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: RH provides dashboards for users, facility reps, and admins.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: RH supports mobile, desktop, and tablet access.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: RH connects with scheduling and reporting tools.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: RH secures API access via HTTPS.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: RH optimizes storage for schedules and recycling data.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: RH ensures 24/7 uptime with backups and scheduled maintenance.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: RH supports regional settings and multiple languages.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: RH links with municipal programs and environmental tracking systems.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: RH enables facility searches, schedule management, and impact tracking.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Users include individuals, facility reps, and regulators.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: RH depends on third-party data accuracy and external integrations.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: RH assumes compliance with data privacy laws and secure API access.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Facility: Recycling center listed in RH.
Schedule: User-defined drop-off or pickup time.
Impact Report: Summary of recycling activities.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with Google Maps for facility searches and route optimization.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall send email and mobile notifications for schedules and facility updates.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-003: The system shall link with scheduling and reporting tools.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow users to TO-BE-DEFINED.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall enable users to save favorite facilities and track recycling history (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall allow facility reps to update accepted materials and availability (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive interface with interactive maps.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall load search results within 2 seconds and support 5,000 users.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store user profiles, schedules, and recycling history.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall manage facility listings, accepted materials, and schedules.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with GDPR and encrypt data using AES-256.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to ISO 27001 and GDPR data protection standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall enforce RBAC with MFA for admin access.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall maintain 99.9% uptime with failover protection.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-003: The system shall enforce API rate limiting (100 requests/min per user).

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests facility searches, schedule updates, and notifications.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: Includes system workflows, API documentation, and compliance policies.
[SEC] 5. References: GDPR, ISO 27001, Google Maps API, HTTPS protocols, and AES-256 encryption.
